Judo is one of the most popular martial arts which improves physical fitness, balance, flexibility, coordination and posture.? These sessions have a highly-motivating and rewarding non-competitive grading scheme so ideal for beginners and graded students of the sport.

Pilates is a functional way of raising your activity levels, especially if you’d like to improve your mobility or are recovering from an injury. Pilates can be adapted to raise the fitness levels of someone less active, and it can challenge someone very fit. Making it open to both men and women alike and whatever your fitness level, Pilates can accommodate you.

What this class is great for:
Pilates strengthens the core and can bring many health benefits such as helping with back pain, improving body alignment, posture, flexibility and much more. It is an exercise system that focuses on stretching and strengthening the whole body improving your body’s balance and muscle strength. With a variety of Pilates classes constantly running at one of the Better Leisure Centres you can easily sign up to a Pilates class and reap the benefits today.

Who can take part:
Pilates is suitable for people of all levels of fitness. You’re never too late to start; Pilates can be devised into a programme of exercises tailored to your fitness levels.

Difficulty Level:
Beginner - Advanced

Other facilities:
Changing and shower facilities are available for use before and after the class.
You are recommended to use lockers that are available for any belongings.  Lockers generally take 20p or a £1.00 coin although we do not take any responsibility for the valuables left in them.

Other classes you might be interested in:
Core Stability
Yoga - Hatha
Ab Blast

Group Cycle is indoor cycling as its best. This high-energy cycling class allows you to cycle with other gym goers and is a great way to get in a vigorous and effective workout. A typical group cycle class lasts for roughly about 30-45 minutes and consists of an instructor guiding you through different cycle routines on an indoor bike. The great thing is that you can work at your own pace in this entertaining class.

What this class is great for:
Group cycling strengthens the heart and lungs whilst increasing lower body muscular strength and endurance. This short, but high intensity, high energy workout can help burn a huge amount of calories in a short amount of time and help keep your muscles toned. Cycle your way to a fitter and healthier lifestyle with a Group Cycle class today at a Better Leisure Centre. With a huge variety of different class times you can easily find a class that suits and works around you.

Who can take part:
Group Cycle offers a variety of different classes available and a range of classes for all fitness levels anyone and everyone can join from absolute beginners to advanced cyclists.

Difficulty Level:
Beginner - Advanced

Other facilities:
Changing and shower facilities are available for use before and after the class.
You are recommended to use lockers that are available for any belongings.  Lockers generally take 20p or a £1.00 coin although we do not take any responsibility for the valuables left in them.

Other classes you might be interested in:
Extreme Interval Fitness
Total Body Conditioning

Dance yourselves fit in a fun, dynamic and high intensity workout of dance aerobics. If you’re looking for a fun way to get in shape and stay that way, then dance aerobics is for you. A typical Dance Aerobics class consists of choreographed routines infused with the typical high and low tempo aerobics. Have fun in this aerobics class where you can enjoy a good cardio workout that combines dance aerobics with core stability and stretching.

What this class is great for:
Dance Aerobics can improve your flexibility, fitness, and cardiovascular health. Above all Dance Aerobics is one of the best ways to have a fun work out and get fit at the same time. Sign up to one of the Better Leisure Centres across the UK that host a wide range of classes for all abilities. With a variety of classes during the daytime or evening there’s always a class to suit you.

Who can take part:
Dance Aerobics sessions are a great workout that use dance moves that are based on simple dance steps which are fun and easy to follow. Making it suitable for all fitness levels.

Difficulty Level:
Beginner - Intermediate

Other facilities:
Changing and shower facilities are available for use before and after the class.
You are recommended to use lockers that are available for any belongings.  Lockers generally take 20p or a £1.00 coin although we do not take any responsibilities for the valuables left in them.

Circuit classes are fast-paced classes in which gym members enjoy a fun action-packed multi station group exercise class. Making it perfect for those who can’t decide on a right exercise, circuits helps put variety back into your workouts. With no coordination required, participants begin at a particular station and exercises for 30 seconds to 2 minutes per station. The instructor times each workout station and when times up, gym goers then moves onto another free station to exercise. Circuits are a great way to breakup your gym workout routine and can help you exercise more efficiently in a short amount of time.

What this class is great for:
Circuits can do so many things for you, with tons of health benefits added it’s a great form of exercise that’s easy to incorporate into your daily routine. Circuit training classes can increase your strength, aerobic fitness and burn lots of calories. Join a circuit class today at a local Better Gym, you can be sure to find classes to suit your timetable.

Who can take part:
This class is moderately demanding and can tend to be intense, but it’s completely adaptable to individuals. Where beginners can use less weight and perform simpler moves whereas more experienced exercisers can opt for heavier and advanced moves. So everyone can achieve a good full-body workout.

Difficulty Level:
Intermediate - Advanced

Other facilities:
Changing and shower facilities are available for use before and after the class.
You are recommended to use lockers that are available for any belongings.  Lockers generally take 20p or a £1.00 coin although we do not take any responsibility for the valuables left in them.

Other classes you might be interested in:
Outdoor Boot camp
Boxfit

A Power Pump class is really beneficial to those starting out in the world of fitness as it’s where attendees will learn the right techniques for the basic moves associated with lifting barbells and plates. Not only can it accommodate beginners it is also challenging for experienced gym goers. A Power Pump session includes a skilled instructor teaching an entire class proper lifting methods using barbells and plates incorporating sets & reps for each muscle group being worked accompanied by high energy motivating music that will really get your heart ‘pumping’!  The class provides a fun and upbeat environment to exercise in.

What this class is great for:
This class is designed to firm, tone, strengthen and define all the muscles in your body. This full-body workout can help you burn calories, decreases body fat and all the while targeting multiple muscle groups at once. Find the next Power Pump class at your local Better Leisure Centre where you could enjoy a challenging new workout.

Who can take part:
The great thing about a Power Pump class is that instructors can accommodate all fitness levels, so it really doesn’t matter if you’re a beginner or a seasoned exerciser - everyone can work out together. Power Pump classes draw a crowd of young and old, male & female, making it an ideal fitness class for all.

Difficulty Level:
Beginner - Intermediate

Other facilities:
Changing and shower facilities are available for use before and after the class.
You are recommended to use lockers that are available for any belongings.  Lockers generally take 20p or a £1.00 coin although we do not take any responsibility for the valuables left in them.

Other classes you might be interested in:
BTT

session:
Small Group Training Session

 

Strength and Conditioning
description: A short intense gym workout tailored to the group, guaranteed to challenge you and push you towards your goals.
Extreme Interval Training

Core Stability is a class that focuses on the deep postural muscles.  Core stability is the term used to describe how the muscles of your trunk help keep your spine and body stable. This class uses innovative equipment such as medicine balls, exercise balls and stability discs; all this is coupled with a routine of low-impact exercises that can help improve your posture and strength. This low-impact core stability class could see up to 300 calories being burned per hour, making you shift those pesky pounds without you even knowing it!

What this class is great for:
This challenging class works to tone and condition all major muscles of the torso, especially the abdominal and back muscles. Core stability sessions can help many conditions, but it is particularly effective for a variety of post-injury rehabilitation remedies such as lower back pain, injury prevention, muscle strength and proprioception which is your body’s ability to sense movement within joints and joint position can be improved. If you’re looking to improve your fitness levels or to recover from an injury and want to get back into exercising, then a core stability class is for you. Find a class suitable for you at one of the Better Leisure Centres today and who knows you could be stronger than ever, thanks to a core stability workout.

Who can take part:
This no impact strength improving workout is perfect for anyone and everyone. A core stability class isn’t too demanding and is ideal for posture management making it suitable for all adults.  

Difficulty Level:
Beginner - Intermediate

Other facilities:
Changing and shower facilities are available for use before and after the class.
You are recommended to use lockers that are available for any belongings.  Lockers generally take 20p or a £1.00 coin although we do not take any responsibility for the valuables left in them.

Other classes you might be interested in:
Ab Blast
Pilates
Functional Training
